meanings.definition: To enclose in a shrine or sacred place.
meanings.sent1: The villagers decided to inshrining the ancient relic in the newly built temple.
meanings.sent2: The family tradition involves inshrining a special candle in the center of the altar.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was caught inshrining shiny pebbles in its nest.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were inshrined in the locket she wore around her neck.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece inshrined the beauty of nature in every brushstroke.

meanings.definition: To preserve or cherish as sacred or precious.
meanings.sent1: The old book was inshrined in a glass case to protect it from dust and damage.
meanings.sent2: She inshrined the locket her grandmother gave her as a symbol of love.
meanings.sent3: The children inshrined their secret hideout in the backyard with a 'No Adults Allowed' sign.
meanings.sent4: His words of wisdom were inshrined in the hearts of all who heard him speak.
meanings.sent5: The small town inshrined the memory of its founder by naming the central square after him.
